comments.body: What about adding some notes about where/how the user could find the list of existing phases to be used for this field? (same for the JoinConfiguration & public API types)

someone might decide to build a custom "unified control plane" image that is not called hyperkube.
in such a case they would have to name it "hyperkube" for kubeadm to be able to work with it.

this at least solves upgrade issues for us...

If some users override this with their own image, then it should be based on hyperkube. Hence tagging it appropriately and setting it up on their own repository is the way to go.
Definitely we should not allow users to put whatever image they see fit in here and the bool value is the best solution for me.

The Naming is confusing here. 

The APIEndpoint struct has an APIEndpoint member.
Sorry, the way github collapsed this changeset made me misinterpret this.  I expanded it looks ok.

Or... are you looking for the "status" we discussed at the end of the call yesterday?

If this is the case, please consider that this PR implements only the "spec", while the status will be implemented the next PR (in the form of `map[bindaddress]APIEndoint`, but I'm figuring out details right now)

> map[bindaddress]APIEndoint

i though more about this. we ideally need to map against the address the user provides instead of always defaulting to the address of the network interface, because we do have `--apiserver-advertise-address`.

if i understand this correctly this might result in an interesting situation, but i guess we can comment more in the next PR. :\

Wandering if it makes more sense to have two TLS bootstrap tokens, one inside BootstrapToken and one inside File.
WDYT?
Ok according to original Lucas design
I'm not fully convinced by calling this path, but I don't have better suggestion ATM...
How about `KubeConfigFile`? Yet it sounds kind of the same to me.
Leave as it is ATM
If I'm not wrong we are missing DiscoveryToken (unless it is intentional to conflate Token and DiscoveryToken)
Ok according to original Lucas design
Wandering if we should make this `string` instead of accepting array of string and throwing an error in validation if more than one string is passed
Please make this string; we are not accepting more than one value ATM and there is no plan for supporting >1 API Endpoints as far as I know
This will come in as a followup PR as the change is not trivial (currently there is a lot of code in kubeadm, that looks upon this as a `[]string` and doing correct handling of multiple API Servers).
I don't see what this particular change has todo with the kubelet env mundging, but we're too late to debate this anymore.
I just moved the two first-time-only fields we have to the top, so it's easier to see a difference between those and the rest. Does that make sense to you?

If we are considering convergence towards cluster API, the [corresponding object](https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-deploy/blob/5d7e0ecaec541c561f6e18cb4500c11554cfa406/cluster-api/pkg/apis/cluster/v1alpha1/machine_types.go#L51) is named `machineSpec`. 
WDYT? it is too early for starting to unify naming?

i think we should stick with something custom like `NodeRegistrationOptions` for now, mostly because of the `ExtraArgs` field, assuming it's going to be replaced with a config map eventually (i.e. graduate out of using args?). at a later point we can start converging towards the `MachineSpec`.

2c.
What about adding a note that explain difference between  extra args and KubeletConfiguration (machine specific vs cluster wide)
Very good point :+1:

Is it necessary to indicate the default value of such fields? If the consts of these default values, e.g. `DefaultEtcdCertDir`, change (though they may not) and we forget to update the comment here, it will lead to inconsistency. @kargakis WDYT?
Defaults do not change in the same version.
New version means new types so these comments need to be vetted anyway.

Is it possible that we don't change the type but change the below const between versions? If so, `Defaults to "/etc/kubernetes/pki/etcd"` is a "hard-coded" comment.

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/29aff5bf47132ee40d3ff1e9bf508acf21a712f7/cmd/kubeadm/app/apis/kubeadm/v1alpha1/defaults.go#L60-L61

That constant should not change otherwise we are breaking existing users. Newer versions should use their own constants.

Btw, we "hardcode" defaults in comments elsewhere too.
https://github.com/kubernetes/api/blob/65f67c9cb59d466d2eb758ad9d5ad016eb43c2aa/apps/v1/types.go#L109
Since defaults are API, there is no reason to hide them in constants.
agreed :)
Could you add a // TODO: This is temporary and ideally we would like to switch all components to use ComponentConfig + ConfigMaps.

Gah, I think we should get rid of this.  
/cc @roberthbailey
Comment out if unused and we can cycle through later.
We should also put a //TODO comment here about replacing with dynamic kubelet configuration.
FYI: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/48228
Are you intending to `MasterConfiguration.Discovery` in a separate PR?
@errordeveloper That's handled in https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/41417 which builds upon this one
